sources.title: Tulsa (1949)
sources.description: Cherokee Lansing's rancher father is killed in a fight with the Tanner Oil Company. Cherokee plans revenge by bringing in her own wells with the help of oil expert Brad Brady and childhood friend Jim Redbird. Mystic Nights Videos

sources.title: Tulsa (1949)
sources.description: It's Tulsa, Oklahoma at the start of the oil boom and Cherokee Lansing's rancher father is killed in a fight with the Tanner Oil Company. Cherokee plans revenge  by bringing in her own wells with the help of oil expert Brad Brady and  childhood friend Jim Redbird. When the oil and the money start gushing in, both  Brad and Jim want to protect the land but Cherokee has different ideas. What  started out as revenge for her father's death has turned into an obsession for  wealth and power. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/tulsa-1949/

sources.title: Tulsa (1949) SUSAN HAYWARD
sources.description:
Stars: Susan Hayward, Robert Preston, Pedro Armendáriz
Director: Stuart Heisler

It's Tulsa, Oklahoma at the start of the oil boom and Cherokee Lansing's rancher father is killed in a fight with the Tanner Oil Company.

sources.title: Tulsa (1949) Western Movie | Starring Susan Hayward & Robert Preston
sources.description:
Tempestuous loves! Lusty adventures! Violent hates! 
In Tulsa, after a rancher dies during a feud with a major oil company, his daughter, driven by revenge, starts digging for oil herself.

Original title: Tulsa (1949) 

Director: Stuart Heisler
Writers: Frank S. Nugent, Curtis Kenyon 
Stars: Susan Hayward, Robert Preston, Pedro Armendáriz 
Genres: Classics, Drama, Western 
Budget: $1,158,035 


00:00 Full Movie (with subtitles)
03:13 Cherokee Lansing discovers Tanner's oil pollution killed her cattle and father.
05:41 Cherokee partners with Brad Brady to drill for oil on her land despite Jim Redbird's warnings.
29:01 Cherokee and Brad hit saltwater instead of oil, risking bankruptcy after$15,000 loss.
39:09 Cherokee's well strikes a massive gusher, transforming her into Tulsa's oil queen overnight.
47:00 Brad proposes oil conservation to landowners, but Tanner vows to flood-drill for maximum profit.
65:02 Cherokee betrays Jim Redbird's trust by approving more wells, fracturing her engagement to Brad.
76:01 Jim Redbird ignites Tanner's oil field, triggering a catastrophic fire after losing his land.
1:21:17 Cherokee and Brad unite to save Jim and endorse conservation, reshaping Tulsa's oil future.


@CultCinemaClassics 

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=UUMOycDFnpMeWzaITQSD1dWsOA

metadata.Plot: It's Tulsa, Oklahoma at the start of the oil boom and Cherokee Lansing's rancher father is killed in a fight with the Tanner Oil Company. Cherokee plans revenge by bringing in her own wells with the help of oil expert Brad Brady and childhood friend Jim Redbird. When the oil and the money start gushing in, both Brad and Jim want to protect the land but Cherokee has different ideas. What started out as revenge for her father's death has turned into an obsession for wealth and power.
metadata.Writer: Frank S. Nugent, Curtis Kenyon, Richard Wormser
metadata.Actors: Susan Hayward, Robert Preston, Pedro Armendáriz
